review: I am new to certain types of technology. And I was very impressed with Amazon Fire. Movies and TV come through quickly and clearly. I was just thinking about getting what we used to call a stereo so I could play more music. But to my surprise my TV has now become my stereo. Amazon Fire automatically picked up the music on my computer and saved me some bucks! I have not tried any other type of TV streaming (or whatever you should call it) but I give Amazon Fire 2 thumbs up!

review: My entire family, including myself were very disappointed with our purchase of Fire TV. What was not made clear in the Fire TV advertisement on Amazon, is that it is ALL PAY TV. You have a choice to rent or purchase everything that you watch, nothing is free. Also, to make matters worse, If you rent a movie or a particular TV program to watch, you are allocated a certain amount of time to watch it, before you must pay to watch it again. If you elect to purchase the program or movie or video, you can watch it as long as you want to, but of course you pay a lot more for this option.We all came to the same conclusion that our Metrocast Cable TV was a far superior option for the amount of money involved. Everything is built in from local TV stations, to Boston stations, including a free movie station, to a full range of music selections, including classical and light classical, special stations for children, including the Disney channels etc.The Fire TV is an elective option for only upper income and high income families. It is just too much money for middle and lower income families, like mine, for the programming that is offered.Very Truly Yours,Philip Nordmark and family, Northfield, New Hampshire
author: Philip Nordmark
